column4: 4.) There are no Cancel or Restore Defaults  buttons in many places. So, I can't change my mind?
> No one can answer my questions? <
>>> I see no one answers my questions. I'll paste them soon to pastebin, and link it. <<<
read back pls
es. So, I can't change my mind?
I'm using Ubuntu 10.04 LTS (Lucid Lynx).
what language?  Maybe those parts haven't been translated
Installed with Hungarian, switched to English but some parts remained Hungarian.
maybe you can help translate? https://edge.launchpad.net/rosetta (also search wiki.ubuntu.com for the hungarian translation team)
wait, you want it all to be english now?
you misunderstood my problem. I switched FROM HUNGARIAN TO ENGLISH.
how did you switch?
When logging in.
what did you switch to?
I installed Ubuntu with Hungarian language. Then, I decided to switch to English because of the untranslated things. But now, some things are HUNGARIAN :/
yeah, I understand that.  What exactly was the language that you selected at the login screen?  Also, what's in your ~/.dmrc and /etc/environment?
A moment...
I've selected English from the Language drop-down list.
apt only does what you tell it to... Surely it told you what it was going to do and asked if you were sure
did you make it executable?
How can I do it?
chmod +x /path/to/file
oh thanks
